title: IoT Based Smart Irrigation System for Precision Farming. Team Krishi-Shakti

tasks.task: Present and explain a smart irrigation system using IoT technology for agriculture.
subtasks: Introduce Prishy Shakti team and problem statement ID 1554.
Explain the challenge of water scarcity in agriculture.
Describe traditional irrigation methods and their limitations.
Present the smart irrigation system's features (IoT, sensor data, real-time monitoring).
Detail the robotic car components (sensors, motor, user interface).
Explain the role of soil testing, moisture, temperature, nutritional levels, and rain detection.
Describe ESP826's function in controlling the car.
Outline the data analysis process using IoT Blink platform and AIML.
Explain the user interface display of temperature, water level, humidity, GPRS, nutrition, and insects.
Demonstrate the mechanism for fertilizer pumping based on farmer input.
Mention the GPS sensor for car location.
Highlight the car's omnidirectional mobility.

tasks.task: Create a marketing video showcasing the smart irrigation system.
subtasks: Prepare a video presentation.
Include real-time data from the irrigation system sensors.
Display the analyzed data on a user interface.
Show the robotic car's operation in a field scenario.
Integrate a demonstration of the system in action (already considered in the previous subtask).
Collect feedback from potential farmers.
Analyze feedback and make necessary adjustments to the system.
Continuously update the firmware and sensors based on user input.
